name: GoodyTag
tag_list: coupons, social-advertising, social-coupon, advertising, tagging, visual-tagging, word-of-mouth, twitter-advertising, facebook-advertising, facebook-apps, twitter-apps, applications, facebook-application, twitter-application, application, app, rewards, qr
overview:
GoodyTag is a platform to create User Generated Content Facebook& Twitter apps that delivers branding ability to the people. Users’ photos are valueable assets: With GoodyTag®, advertiser can let his customers advertise on their own photos and determine an easy way to reward them, such as with coupons, points, freebies , draws and more.

How does it work? Be connected on Facebook & try it yourself Here: https://apps.facebook.com/goodytag/?adid=450

The app has a back end for advertisers, in which they can create their own branded GoodyTag application, within few minutes, such as the above.

GoodyTag and GoodyTwit reward users with coupons, discounts, draws and promotions for adding brand’s image to own photo. The generated app is easy to use and presents an avenue for the user to recommend goods & services to their social network.

With millions of Facebook & Twitter users, GoodyTag takes word-of-mouth advertising to a new level. It is a win-win application that has potential to help smaller brands grow and larger brands recognize customers while giving the power, and reward, to the user.

All generated apps form one main application, in which the user could browse the daily coupons and promotions available in his geo location.

http://apps.facebook.com/goodytag

What let to the idea?

“My friend uploaded photos from a triathlon, where he was wearing this beautiful Triathlon suit so I asked him where he got it. Eventually I got to the swimsuit brand’s Facebook fan page, which led me to their online shop. I ended up purchasing a similar suit along with a watch totaling about $300. I just spent $300 on that shop and I only knew it existed because I saw it on my Facebook newsfeed… what a shame my friend wasn’t rewarded by the shop for telling me about it”.
